botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort, may cause skin allergy. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Tulipa are bulbous perennials with characteristic flowers, in a wide range of colours, in spring
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Triumph Group tulips have single, cup-shaped flowers in a wide colour range, in mid and late spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant 10 to 15cm deep in fertile, well-drained soil in a sunny position. Protect from excessive wet and shelter from strong winds. See tulip cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by lifting and separating offsets
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead after flowering, and allow flower stem and foliage to die down naturally
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs, aphids and stem and bulb eelworm; squirrels may eat the bulbs
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to tulip fire, tulip virus and bulb rots
